muchart 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Generate random samples from the gamma distribution

    r_g.Rd

    This function generates random samples from the gamma distribution.

    Usage

    r_g(lots, n, mu, k, ...)

    Arguments

    lots

    The number of lots

    n

    The sample size

    mu

    The mean of the gamma distribution

    k

    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution

    ...

    Additional arguments to be passed to rgamma() from the stats package

    Value

    A matrix of random samples

    Examples

    r_g(lots = 5, n = 10, mu = 5, k = 2)
#>                n_1      n_2      n_3       n_4       n_5      n_6       n_7
#> sample_1 0.2306129 3.481441 5.265898 1.5721771 7.0079743 3.145348 1.5488450
#> sample_2 2.4698376 3.770118 6.840743 6.7213215 0.9809688 5.353342 2.6074378
#> sample_3 5.3660739 6.924872 7.222694 0.5277633 5.5769486 2.630632 2.1305559
#> sample_4 4.5158987 3.967926 3.434960 4.9838374 0.4242246 3.802158 1.4891646
#> sample_5 1.6840366 2.933131 3.558168 7.0181150 4.6297357 3.228559 0.7206962
#>               n_8      n_9      n_10
#> sample_1 1.621441 5.990145  7.265390
#> sample_2 5.056510 4.051403  5.991450
#> sample_3 3.873233 6.223946  2.444264
#> sample_4 4.367323 1.983253  9.463826
#> sample_5 1.833212 4.357169 14.675165
r_g(lots = 10, n = 20, mu = 10, k = 3)
